name: The Fairies: Jump Jump Star
description:
Meet Harmony and Rhapsody - the world's most beautiful pink and purple fairies, live on stage! In this enchanting and brand new show, Jump Jump Star, the Fairies laugh, dance and sing with their special friends, Barnaby the Bizzy Buzzy Bee, Elf the Fairy Cake Maker and Wizzy the Wizard, as they explore just what it takes to become a real, true fairy. And of course, to be a true fairy, you need to know how to Jump Jump Star!

Transaction fees apply.

entryCosts.definition: price per person in a group of 10+
Premium seating includes a meet and greet and a gift.

name: Lloyd Cole: Standards
description:
Arguably Lloyd Cole's best album to date, Standards features musical contributions from Matthew Sweet, ex-Lou Reed sideman Fred Maher, former Commotion Blair Cowan, Joan as Police Woman and Lloyd's son Will.

Lloyd Cole is no stranger to Australian shores. He was frontman for The Commotions and their stadium tour of 1986. His Small Ensemble toured in 2011 and there were many solo tours in between.

The 2014 tour comes on the back of a new album: Standards, recorded in late 2012 after Lloyd was inspired by the release of Bob Dylan's latest album Tempest.

.

name: Children and Family Programs: Story Time
description:
Bring the family to the National Portrait Gallery and listen to stories of fairyland illustrated by Ida Rentoul Outhwaite.

Using materials provided; draw, make and create your own visual response to the stories by the acclaimed author.

Ideal for all ages and abilities. Children must be accompanied. Bookings essential.

This program was made possible with funds donated by Tim Fairfax AC.

entryCosts.definition: Children must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Wayne Brady: It's my line
description:
The multi-talented Wayne Brady returns with his new It's My Line tour. For more than a decade, Wayne Brady has wowed audiences worldwide with his television and film acting, improvisation, singing and dancing.

One of the most versatile performers in show business today, the multi-award winning star is well known for his hilarious improvised antics, unique musical talents and limitless impersonation skills as showcased on the hit shows Whose Line is it Anyway, The Wayne Brady Show, The Dave Chappelle Show, Let's Make a Deal and Don't Forget the Lyrics.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Adult Programs: Portrait learning circle: Kate Grenville by Jenny Sages
description:
Meet for conversation and sharing of ideas around the selected portrait; Kate Grenville by Jenny Sages. This is a recurring opportunity to learn, share and meet new people as you experience a more in-depth experience of the Portrait Gallery collection.

The Portrait Learning Circle is facilitated by members of the National Portrait Gallery Access and Learning team.

Bookings are essential.

name: Soweto Gospel Choir
description:
South Africa's most heavenly voices, the multi Grammy award-winning, Soweto Gospel Choir are returning to Canberra.

Their performances and recordings have been lauded by critics, by their public, and by their fellow artists. They have collaborated, recorded and performed with artists including Bono and U2, Aretha Franklin, Stevie Wonder, Robert Plant, Celine Dion, Red Hot Chilli Peppers, Peter Gabriel, Josh Grobin as well as classical music stars including Andre Rieu.

Book your tickets now. Transaction fees apply.

name: NAIDOC Week: Guided Walk of Reconciliation Place
description:
Come and enjoy a free guided walk to encounter the inspiring artworks that make up this important site and the stories behind them. Start where Australia's stories are kept at the National Library and conclude where decisions are made at the High Court of Australia.

Reconciliation Place is in the heart of Australia's National Capital and is a place which recognises the importance of understanding the shared history of indigenous and non-indigenous Australians.

name: Kanga Cup International Youth Football Tournament
description:
The Kanga Cup is an annual youth soccer tournament held in Canberra. It is the most prestigious youth soccer tournament of its kind to be currently operating within Australia and is the largest of its kind in the southern hemisphere.

Winning a Kanga Cup is the most coveted prize in Australian youth soccer. The tournament is open to club, school, association or community based teams. It caters for male and female youth ranging from 11 years to 19 years of age.
address: Various locations in the North of Canberra, Canberra

name: Brumbies v Force
description:
See the University of Canberra Brumbies take on the Western Force at GIO Stadium Canberra.

Widely regarded as the world's toughest provincial rugby tournament, the Super Rugby competition pitches the best players from New Zealand, Australia and South Africa together with five teams from each conference fighting for the win.

Tickets from Ticketek. Transaction fees apply.

name: The Incredible Book Eating Boy
description:
Oliver Jeffers' bestselling picture book The Incredible Book Eating Boy comes to life in a play by Maryam Master. This premiere Australian adaptation is ideal for children 3-8 and their families.

Henry loves books; not to read, but to eat. The more books he eats, the smarter he gets. He's on his way to being the smartest boy in the world! But one day he feels sick to his stomach. And the information is so jumbled up, he can't digest it! Can Henry find a way to enjoy books without using his teeth?

entryCosts.definition: Price per person, not per family

name: Black & Gold Winter Magic at Telstra Tower
description:
Experience the glitz and glamour of Black Gold Winter Magic at one of Canberra's most iconic and scenic venues, the Telstra Tower.

Be treated to a canapé style, truffle menu designed and prepared by MasterChef Finalist Mindy Woods matched with cocktails designed exclusively by Platinum Bar solutions. Don your most glamourous black and gold attire and be transported into a decadent, gourmet, black and gold experience.

This is a one night only red carpet affair created for The Truffle Festival by Mindy Woods, Platinum Bar Solutions and in collaboration with Dynamic Events Canberra.

Tickets strictly limited. Bookings essential.

name: Old Bus Depot Markets - Creative Fibre
description:
Immerse yourself in creativity with the region's most talented textile artists showcasing and selling their work.

Why visit? Now in its tenth year, Creative Fibre is your opportunity to engage with the region's textile artists - people who design, print on fabric, weave, make baskets, knit, hand dye fabric - learn about the processes involved, and take home original works.

Stallholders and items you'll find: Beautifully handcrafted home wares and clothing. The Australian National University's School of Textiles showcase student work, plus have information about courses. Other regional guilds also participate.

name: Celebrating the 50th year of AIATSIS: 'After 200 years' photographic exhibition
description: Take this special opportunity to view a sample of the stunning images collected during the After 200 Years photographic project. A three year project led by the Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies (AIATSIS) - After 200 Years documents the different lifestyles of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people living in remote and urban communities during the late 1980s.

name: National Portrait Gallery Book Group
description:
Learn, share and meet new people as part of the National Portrait Gallery's Book Group.

This month join Dr Sarah Engledow Historian at the National Portrait Gallery to discuss Eucalyptus, Murray Bail's novel of Love, landscape and the enthralling power of language.

The National Portrait Gallery Book group promotes a deeper understanding of biography and how it intersects with portraiture.

Bookings are essential.

name: School holiday paper making workshops
description:
Head to the Australian National Botanic Gardens these school holidays and have fun making paper out of old jeans!

Join Paperworks Inc. and learn how to make your own paper and craft items from a range of recycled materials.

Spaces limited, online bookings essential.

Workshops suitable for children 7 - 12 years.

All materials supplied.

name: Pedal powered film screening and Q&A
description:
The Canberra Environment Centre is holding a pedal powered screening of Simon Cunich's 'Growing Change'. The film documents his investigation into the food crisis of 2012 and subsequent travels to Venezuela to study the country's rising food revolution.

Get cosy at the co-op with chai and muffins, and talk about the film in an open question and answer session with Simon and Gardening's Australia's wild man Costa Georgiadis. Head along with your appetite and questions about food security!

Bookings essential via their website.

name: July school holiday program - Mini Museum Curator Workshops
description:
Become a Mini Museum Curator at the Museum of Australian Democracy at Old Parliament House these July school holidays.

Have fun with a professional photographer and be a photo curator in the first week of the holidays.

Be a video curator in the second week of the holidays. You'll get to build a play space and have fun with an artist to make your own Super 8 style video.

The photos and videos from these sessions will be used in the new children's exhibition Play Up which opens in August.

Recommended age: 5-12 and carers

name: Discovery Space: Discovery Island
description:
Discovery Space provides a wonderful opportunity for parents and children to participate in hands-on activities that connect to the National Museum of Australia's galleries and exhibitions. Get into the swing of the new Torres Strait Islander gallery 'Lag ' Meta ' Aus' by exploring aspects of island life.

Children can create their own island story headdress and dance in a virtual tropical island scene. Then they can make a woven fish to add to our colourful sea surround installation.

Drop in activities, no bookings necessary.

Donations welcome.

name: EuroScience at Questacon
description:
Discover the past, present and future of European science and technology; from the discovery of dinosaurs, the science of the humble candle, through to a space mission to land on a comet and more!

Presented in collaboration with the ANU Centre for European Studies, an initiative involving four ANU Colleges (Arts and Social Sciences, Law, Business and Economics, and Asia and the Pacific) co-funded by the ANU and the European Union.

For the full programme of activities visit the Questacon website.

entryCosts.definition: 2 adults + 3 children $8 for each additional child

name: Nexis Accountants and Business Advisers 10 Year Anniversary Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Free admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to the public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a luncheon with a view of the horse racing action in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

name: School Holiday afterDARK Tours
description:
Take the kids on a night time journey through the Gardens with an afterDARK Tour these school holidays. The kids will love making their own hand made lantern before discovering some of the Gardens' nocturnal life and secret plant stories.

afterDARK tours are a family fun way to spend a winter evening in the nation's capital.

Tours are suitable for children over five years.

Bookings are essential.

entryCosts.definition: Price includes hot chocolate, lantern making and tour
5 years and over.  Tour not suitable for under 5 years

name: Australian Ice Hockey League: Brave v Adrenaline
description:
See CBR Brave take on Adelaide's Adrenaline here in the nation's capital. It's Game #77. Brave have a good record for winning at home this season. Do the Adelaide team have a chance?

Grab your coats, scarves and mittens and head to the Phillip Ice Skating Centre to see the ice hockey action.

Get there early for the best vantage point.

name: Patyegarang
description:
A young woman of intense and enduring courage, Patyegarang is a proud spirit, an educator and visionary - today inspiring respect and knowledge of Aboriginal language and culture.

Through his distinctive choreography, Bangarra Dance Theatre Artistic Director Stephen Page imagines the sensations and emotions of first contact when this courageous young Aboriginal woman shared her language, her time and her friendship with colonist, Lieutenant William Dawes.

Transaction fees apply.

name: The TEN Tenors
description:
The TEN Tenors' unique approach to opera has powered their rise to the top; they have created a sound that is uniquely theirs by bringing rock and classical music together. You can expect the same contrast of raw power and soothing beauty in this special evening of the best of Broadway.

The TEN Tenors perform an average of 250 shows per year across seven continents. They have four gold CDs and two platinum, two gold DVDs and one platinum.

Tickets from Canberra Ticketing. Booking fees may apply.
address: Civic Square, London Circuit, Civic Square

name: Jeff Lang: I live a Lot in my head these days Album Launch
description:
Acclaimed musician Jeff Lang returns to launch his newest record I Live A lot In My Head These Days, released in Australia this May.

Based in Australia, Lang has earned worldwide acclaim as a virtuosic guitarist, dynamic songwriter, unique live performer. With a back catalogue of 14 studio albums, Jeff has featured at major festivals, pubs, clubs, arts centres and venues internationally. Blending rock, roots, folk, blues, instrumentals, and improvisation.

"In a world where music is diluted by money and plasticine, give thanks that Jeff Lang is out there...He paints pictures in sound." BEAT MAGAZINE

name: Celebrate Bastille Day 2014
description:
Celebrate Bastille Day 2014. Gather some friends, a great bottle of wine and head for the open fires at Sweet Copper for a truly memorable French dining experience! Enjoy a five course French Provincial Feast.

Bastille Day, the French national holiday, commemorates the storming of the Bastille Prison, on 14 July 1789 which marked the beginning of the French Revolution.

name: Children and Family Programs: Portrait Play
description:
Explore portraits through participating in drawing and creative activities in the galleries.

This is a great opportunity for children from four to eight to share with family and friends.

All children must be accompanied by a participating adult.

Bookings are essential.

This program made possible with funds donated by Tim Fairfax.

Music lovers are not to miss COZMO perform at The High Court of Australia. COZMO is a small mandolin ensemble. Its founding members have played with mandolin orchestras in the Netherlands, Germany and the USA and in May 2015 they will again perform in Germany's BDZ Eurofestival as members of the 25-member Australis Ensemble.

COZMO's repertoire ranges from the light classical to contemporary -offering something for all audiences to enjoy!

name: National Portrait Gallery Portraits on Sunday: Out of the Shadows: subjects matter
description:
Brenda L Croft and Darrell Sibosado were subjects in the luminous black and white portraits by renowned Wiradjuri/Kamilaroi visual artist and film-maker Michael Riley and close friends with the artist.

A decade after Riley's death his peers share their memories of a gifted artist and friend whose legacy includes the intimate, revelatory, unaffected images in Beauty and Strength: Portraits by Michael Riley.

name: Children and Family Programs: Family Space
description:
These school holidays, take some time with the family and explore the Collection at the National Portrait Gallery. Experience the gallery while participating in activities that the whole family can enjoy together.

This opportunity is available daily during the school holidays

This program made possible with funds donated by Tim Fairfax ac

name: On Country: Connect, Work, Celebrate
description:
On Country: Connect, Work, Celebrate showcases contemporary Indigenous land and sea management practices across Australia.

These practices blend millennia of traditional knowledge about Australia's ecology with modern technology and research, to address key environmental issues and protect fragile environments for our future. They also build a connection to country, strengthened through caring for country, being on country and celebrating country.

On show in the First Australians Focus Gallery.

name: Old Masters: Australia's Great Bark Artists
description:
The National Museum of Australia holds the largest collection of bark paintings in the world. Don't miss your chance to see specially selected barks on display in this stunning exhibition, which celebrates the genius of Australia's master bark artists.

Bark painting, as practised by Aboriginal artists for millennia, is one of the greatest traditions of world art. Yet it was only recognised as such late in the 20th century. This exhibition highlights the work of 40 master artists, who have carried one of the oldest continuing traditions of art known to humanity into the modern era.

name: Winter school holiday activities at the Australian War Memorial
description:
Be part of the winter school holiday programs at the Australian War Memorial. Programs include story time, hands-on history activities, drop in craft sessions, women in war performances and gallery talks.

All programs are free. Bookings are not needed.

Please visit the Australian War Memorial events calendar on their website for exact dates and times.

name: Skate in the City
description:
Enjoy frosty fun in the heart of Canberra with an open air ice skating rink. Take the kids to play in the 'Snow Box' and post your photo with free WIFI from the Giant Snow Globe to win great prizes. Don't miss Stars on Ice performances on Friday and Saturday evenings and special daytime school holiday shows.

Enjoy a wonderful cultural experience on the weekends with Scandinavia, Canada, Germany and Austria.

Check the website for full details and ticketing.

entryCosts.definition: Children under 5yrs of age are free

name: Scandinavian Film Festival
description:
The inaugural Scandinavian Film Festival is set to heat up the winter at Palace Electric Cinema with the coolest films from Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland and Iceland!

Don't miss the Opening Night Film and Gala on 8 July. Embark on the adventure of a lifetime with the Australian Premiere of The 100-Year-Old-Man Who Climbed Out The Window And Disappeared, a colourful comedy of unexpected surprises based on Jonas Jonasson's bestselling novel published in more than 35 countries. The film will be followed by an after party with Cake Wines, Nordic flavours and live entertainment.
address: 2 Phillip Law Street, NewActon Nishi, Canberra City

name: Curator Guided Tours - Collection in Focus
description:
Join staff from Military Heraldry and Technology for an exploration of objects in the Australian War Memorial's collection. Each fortnight a different object will be in focus including weapons, transport, uniforms, and personal items. Discover the incredible stories behind the objects.

Monday 7 July 2014: The Wirraway and Archer 'doing the impossible'
Monday 21 July 2014: Battlefield relics from Fromelles

Meet at the information desk at the entry to the Second World War galleries. Entry is free.

See their website for further information.

name: Fireside Stories with Antonio Carluccio
description:
Don't miss this magnificent evening of delightful banter, fireside stories and exquisite food with the much loved and respected Italian cookery writer Antonio Carluccio.

Meet Antonio, sit fireside and hear stories from his incredible life.

Delve into a sensual 6 course truffle degustation prepared by internationally renowned and trained chefs.

Bookings essential.
address: Cnr Northbourne Avenue and Flemington Road, Lyneham

entryCosts.definition:
$165.00 per person including matching wines
$150.00 per person no beverages

name: Antonio Carluccio at Canberra Capital Region Farmers Market
description:
The Capital Region Farmers Market are proud to host renowned Italian chef Antonio Carluccio. Don't miss Antonio's free gourmet cooking demonstration at the Market.

Antonio has written 20 books on Italian cuisine. He will highlight his top tips to transform fresh local produce into a delicious creation.

This event is part of The Truffle Festival, Canberra and Capital Region.
address: Corner of Flemington Road and Northbourne Avenue, Mitchell

name: Wombat Stew
description:
With a cast of 6 multi-talented performers, Wombat Stew is a mouth-watering combination of story-telling, mime, music, dance and puppetry.

This simple story of a dingo who catches a wombat and decides to make gooey, brewy, yummy, chewy wombat stew, has been cleverly developed into a true-blue-dinky-di-big Aussie musical. It's complete with blobs of mud, very fine emu feathers, creepy crawlies, flies, gumnuts and a big bubbling billy can.

Transaction fees apply.

name: Grazing Restaurant Gala Dinner with Antonio Carluccio
description:
Grazing Restaurant is pleased to host The Truffle Festival patron and international celebrity chef Antonio Carluccio for their Gala Dinner.

Menu items include Poached Duck Foie Gras and Apple on Black Rye with Zierholtz Truffle Infused Dark Ale and for desert; Truffle honey and Caramelised White Chocolate Ice Creme Filled Fritter with Chestnut Pudding and Belgium Chocolate Parfait. Check their website for full details.

This Gala Dinner will sell out. To purchase tickets please phone or email Grazing.

In addition, Grazing Restaurant will be featuring a four course Truffle Tasting Menu throughout the Truffle Festival.

name: Darren Percival - Lovelife
description:
See soul-singer and much-loved performer, Darren Percival in Canberra. His latest tour features a mix of original songs and classic covers from The Beatles, Elton John, The Bee Gees, Norah Jones and many more.

Percival is best-known to audiences around the country for his phenomenal performances on the first season of The Voice Australia.

The concert fuses Percival's unique vocal style and charm with soul-stirring performances that you have come to love from one of Australia's much-loved and respected artists.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Antonio Carluccio at Fyshwick Fresh Food Markets
description:
International celebrity chef Antonio Carluccio will be touring the Fyshwick Fresh Food Markets and stopping for tastings and a chat. He'll also be available for booking signings and photographs.

From mid June to mid-August Fyshwick Markets is the place to get fresh local truffles, have truffle for breakfast, brunch or lunch and buy all your truffle products. The markets will be selling only the highest grade truffles. Market staff are always happy to help with recipe ideas and tips on caring for your truffles.

name: National Portrait Gallery: Performance: Winter Canto
description:
Come along to the Winto Canto performance at the National Portrait Gallery with the Etcetera Duo, Russell Garbutt and Julia Cotton. Don't miss this entertaining performance of parts. It's part comedy, part mime, part magic and illusion and it makes for a whole lot of fun.

Choose from one of two thirty minute shows.

name: 3seed and Antonio Carluccio hands-on cooking class
description:
Celebrity Italian chef Antonio Caluccio in conjunction with Andrew Haskins from Canberra's 3seeds are hosting a hands on cooking class incorporating four dishes to be presented as a truffle banquet lunch. Two dishes from Andrew and two from Antonio!

Complimentary Italian wines and recipes included.

Places limited to 40 people. Book now to avoid disappointment!

All bookings available by phoning 3seeds or via their website.

Leading Australian photomedia artist Anne Zahalka was commissioned to document the work and people of Parliament House during its 25th anniversary in 2013. The resulting images go behind the scenes to showcase the important role that people play in supporting the work of the Parliament. From the upkeep of the magnificent gardens to the maintenance of the art collection, and the preparation of meals for parliamentarians, to mention just a few - the exhibition is a testament to the scale and diversity of work that goes on behind the scenes to support the nation's Parliament.

name: Canberra Raiders vs South Sydney Rabbitohs
description:
Watch the Canberra Raiders take on the South Sydney Rabbitohs. Monday night National Rugby League action comes alive at GIO Stadium Canberra for the Green Machine on their home ground.

It's Round 20 of the competition. Make sure you're there to see the action.

Tickets will be on sale from Ticketek. Transaction fees from $4.95 per transaction apply.

name: Take Me Home - The Musical and Life of John Denver
description:
Take Me Home - The Music and Life of John Denver takes you on a musical journey of one of the world's most captivating and celebrated men. Singer Bevan Gardiner, accompanied by international musicians, perform all the John Denver songs with such accuracy and feeling that if you close your eyes you will be effortlessly transported to Denver's era.

His love for life and concerns for the environment are poignantly portrayed in this stage presentation through exclusive film footage.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: 2014 Kenneth Myer Lecture
description:
The 2014 Kenneth Myer Lecture covers Science and Society: Exploring the Role of Research in Australian Lives. Join Nobel Prize winner Professor Brian Schmidt AC as he discusses how science permeates Australian lives, whether through a metaphysical contemplation of our place in the universe, or as we surf the internet using WIFI.

In this lecture, Professor Schmidt will explore the relevance of science day to day, suggest ways that Australia could be getting more out of science, and ponder what science might bring us in the coming decades.

name: Cirque Mother Africa
description:
Direct from a sold-out Broadway season, Mother Africa is returning to Australia after four long years with new and old classic acts, new music and new costumes.

Cirque Mother Africa, the heartbeat of Africa pulsates throughout the jaw-dropping show as the musicians and artistes articulate their passion and love for their homeland. This entertainment extravaganza combines the talents from nine African countries to provide the wonder, suspense and joy of Mother Africa.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Warm Trees Art Installation
description:
Warm Trees is an exciting and colourful display at the National Arboretum Canberra.

Volunteers knit squares, scarves and shapes which are then installed in the forests, gardens, buildings and playground at the National Arboretum. Warm Trees is a social event - the volunteers knit together, share ideas and have fun creating colourful knitted pieces which wrap around trees, drape over sculptures and pop up in unexpected places.

Knitting sessions till 15 July. Exhibit on display July 25 to 31 August.

Everyone is welcome to participate. For more information contact Jocelyn Plovits, Chair of the Friends on the mobile number listed.
address: Forest Drive, off Tuggeranong Parkway, Weston Creek

name: Parasites in Focus exhibition
description:
Parasites in Focus allows you to get up close and personal with the microscopic creepy crawlies that hitch a ride on their unsuspecting victims ... You!

This exhibition depicts the amazing microscopic world of the parasite. Parasites are a part of everyone's life - they infect our pets, the meat and crops we eat, and us.

Kids' activities include learning how to make larger-than-life models and masks of parasites.

Official exhibition opening Thursday 12 June (5:30pm for a 6pm start). Refreshments provided. Children welcome.

name: Masterclass with Lynton Tapp: Truffles with Australian Produce & Game
description:
Join Lynton Tapp, runner up of MasterChef series 5, as he shares his passion for Australian produce and game.

The 'Stockman' Lynton Tapp was a favourite and runner up of MasterChef Series 5. Since completing MasterChef, Lynton has worked to establish himself as a cooking identity around Australia. He currently works at Melbourne's famed Pei Modern, a well known Melbourne Restaurant.

name: afterDARK Firefly Tours
description:
afterDARK Firefly Tours are a wonderful way to spend a winter evening in the nation's capital. Warm your hearts and hands with a delicious hot chocolate then construct your own hand-made lantern. Have your lanterns lit by a guide then embark on a fascinating after dark discovery of the Gardens.

Bookings are essential.

entryCosts.definition: Price includes hot chocolate, lantern and and tour

name: Australian Ice Hockey League: Brave v North Stars
description:
See CBR Brave take on Newcastle's North Stars here in the nation's capital. It's Game #89. Do the Newcastle team have a chance against the home side?

Grab your coats, scarves and mittens and head to the Phillip Ice Skating Centre to see the ice hockey action.

Get there early for the best vantage point.

name: Sydney Comedy Festival Showcase
description:
The Sydney Comedy Festival is back on the road with an awesome line-up of the hottest international and local comedians from the 2014 Festival! The funniest and freshest acts of Sydney's biggest annual comedy event will be hand picked and squeezed into one hilarious night of world-class comedy.

With a cavalcade of comedians that will tickle everyone's funny bone, this is one of the best value tickets in town, so don't miss out!

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Katie Noonan Songbook
description:
In 2013 The Herald Sun announced Katie Noonan one of the 20 greatest Australian singers of all time as voted by her peers. Don't miss this chance to see why four times ARIA award winner Katie Noonan's technical mastery and pure voice make her one of Australia's most versatile and beloved vocalists.

Songbook will see Katie exploring material from throughout her career including songs from George, Katie Noonan and the Captains, Elixir and her acclaimed solo album. This intimate solo performance mode is the perfect setting for Katie to revisit her most popular songs.

Supported by singer-songwriter Jack Carty.

name: Canberra Recorder and Early Music Society (CREMS) at the High Court
description:
Canberra Recorder and Early Music Society (CREMS) was founded in 1974 as a group of recorder players from Canberra and the surrounding region. CREMS play early and modern music in ensembles and recorder orchestra. In this concert Barbara Jerjen will lead CREMS as they perform music of the Renaissance as well as contemporary music arranged for recorder orchestra. In this performance you will see seven different-sized recorders from the tiny sopranino to the very large contra-bass.
CREMS hold workshops in Canberra plus twice yearly weekend-long workshops in Bundanoon in association with the Sydney Society of Recorder Players.

name: GLINT - Glass and Print
description:
Canberra Glassworks and Megalo Print Studio partnered to offer eight artists (four glass, four print) a unique opportunity to explore the connections between printmaking and glass. The project is called GLINT, a combination of Glass and Print. This exhibition presents 'in-process' results of these collaborations.

During a two month residency the artists worked across the facilities of Canberra Glassworks and Megalo. They collaborated to learn from each other, develop skills in a new medium and create new work.

Curator: Alison Alder
Artists: Scott Chaseling, Emilie Patteson, Ben Rak, Annika Romeyn, Dionisia Salas, Mark Thiele, Annie Trevillian and Melinda Willis

name: Children and Family Programs: Winter Festival
Michael Cook: Through My Eyes
description:
Michael Cook: Through My Eyes re-imagines Australia's Prime Ministers.

In this unique exhibition, Michael Cook transposes the faces of Aboriginal people over the faces of twenty seven former prime ministers, encouraging the viewer to ask 'What if?' and to re-think the way they view Australian history.

Through My Eyes (2010) was Michael Cook's first full-scale solo art exhibition, shown in Brisbane and then at the Western Australian Indigenous Art Awards 2011, where it won the 'People's Choice Award'.

The artworks are courtesy of Michael Cook and Andrew Baker Art Dealer, Brisbane.

name: Bartleby
description:
Julian Hobba's adaptation of Herman Melville's 1853 story places Bartleby in a contemporary Australian office. The demands of technology and endless economic growth have made the atmosphere permanently schizophrenic. Brilliantly capable, frustratingly unworkable, he forces the wise old lawyer who employs him to judge between the office - that effective system for managing human behaviour - against the weight of the human soul.

"I think that maybe in every company today there is always at least one person who is going crazy slowly" - Joseph Heller.

name: Adult Programs: Portrait learning circle: Marcia Langton by Brooke Andrew
description:
Meet for conversation and sharing of ideas around the selected portrait; Marcia Langton by Brooke Andrew. This is a recurring opportunity to learn, share and meet new people as you experience a more in-depth experience of the Portrait Gallery collection.

Portrait Learning Circle is facilitated by members of the National Portrait Gallery Access and Learning team.

Bookings are essential.

name: Screening: Quest for country (1993)
description:
Produced under the international From Spirit to Spirit co-production Series for SBS Television, Michael Rileys Quest for Country 1993 is a film about a physical and mental journey of returning home and discovering ancestry and change as Michael Riley travels from the city of Sydney to Wiradjuri/Kamilaroi country.

This film links together Michael Rileys portraiture series A common place: Portraits of Moree Murries 1990 and Yarns from the Talbragar Reserve 1998.

Directed by Michael Riley

name: GIANTS vs North Melbourne
description:
Come along and watch the GIANTS take on North Melbourne in Round 20 of the Toyota Australian Football League (AFL) Premiership Season.

Both of these teams are familiar with StarTrack Oval in Canberra, but the GIANTS have already attracted a passionate home following and will be desperate to reward their Canberra fans with a win.

This is your last chance to see the GIANTS play in the nation's capital in season 2014, so be there to catch all the excitement.

name: Australian Ice Hockey League: Brave v Mustangs
description:
See CBR Brave take on Melbourne's Mustangs here in the nation's capital. It's Game #95. Do the Melbourne team have a chance against the home side?

Grab your coats, scarves and mittens and head to the Phillip Ice Skating Centre to see the ice hockey action.

Get there early for the best vantage point.

name: Sunday Truffle Hunt and Cooking Package
description:
This special Sunday experience starts off with a one hour truffle hunt at French Black Truffles of Canberra with Jason and his labradors.

You will then move onto a cooking demonstration at the Truffle Shed on the farm with Andrew Haskins from 3seeds. Andrew will demonstrate how to make the most of truffles in a variety of dishes and you'll get to taste them!

Book this package through the 3Seeds website. You'll find the Hunt and Cook packages listed after their cooking classes.

name: Australian Ice Hockey League: Brave v Mustangs
description:
See CBR Brave take on Melbourne's Mustangs here in the nation's capital for their last home game. b can the Brave beat the Mustangs?

Grab your coats, scarves and mittens and head to the Phillip Ice Skating Centre to see the last of this season's ice hockey action.

Get there early for the best vantage point.

name: Music at Midday
description:
Thrill to the sounds of the Royal Military College Band!

Canberra Theatre Centre and the Royal Military College host the Music at Midday Concerts six times a year. These lunchtime concerts are very popular all year round. Get there early for a good seat.

Entry to the concerts is by gold coin donation. All funds raised during the concert go to support a local charity.

name: Llewellyn Series 14.3
description:
Stravinsky's Firebird opens the Canberra Symphony Orchestra's third Llewellyn Series concert. The extraordinary beauty of this score lies in its combination of shimmering colours and delicate textures with the infernal power of a massive orchestra in full flight.

Following this masterpiece, David Elton returns to the stage for the intricately detailed, virtuosic Trumpet Concerto by Australian composer, Richard Mills.

The evening concludes with Nicholas Milton conducting Tchaikovsky's Fifth. This work plummets the depths of Tchaikovsky's sorrows, but ultimately triumphs in the extraordinary power and optimism of the human spirit.

name: Truffle Hunts
description:
Take a seasonal truffle hunt between June and August.

Meet in the warmth of The Truffle Shed and learn about the history of Ruffles Estate and French Black Truffles. Discover their intoxicating aroma and hear about the unique difference that truffle brings to a dish.

Follow Snuffle the truffle dog and her handler into the paddock as she locates the scent and tracks the elusive truffle. Take a turn to touch, smell and photograph the freshly dug truffle and Snuffle. See the truffle cleaned and prepared for market.

Finish the experience with your very own truffle crème brulee.

name: Majura Valley Experience
description:
Take a journey through the Majura Valley, enjoy and experience the best local produce.

Start your day at French Black Truffles of Canberra with Sherry for a truffle hunt. Then travel next door to Mount Majura Vineyard where you will enjoy a local truffle infused brie matched with some outstanding wines. Travel down Majura Road to Pod Food in Pialligo to finish your experience with a two course lunch including a glass of Mount Majura Vineyard wine. The entrée and main will both feature Sherry's famed French black truffles.

Contact Kate at Mount Majura for bookings.

name: James Reyne plays Australian Crawl
description:
James Reyne plans to deliver the closest thing fans will every get to an Australian Crawl reunion, as he assembles an exceptional band to play the songbook of Australian Crawl - a no holds barred, full band, rock'n' roll assault, performing the greatest songbook of Aussie Crawl.

Australian Crawl is surely one of Australia's most loved bands. Along with Midnight Oil, Cold Chisel and INXS, they played an integral part in the development of the Australian 'sound' and were one of the truly great rock groups of their time.
address: Civic Square, London Circuit, Canberra City

entryCosts.definition: A Reserve. Transaction fee applies to all tickets

name: Arcadia by Tom Stoppard
description:
Arcadia by Tom Stoppard has been cited by many critics as the finest play from one of the most significant contemporary playwrights in the English language.

In 1809 Thomasina is a precocious teenager with ideas about mathematics well ahead of her time. She studies with her tutor.

In the present a writer and an academic converge on the house. The writer is investigating a hermit who once lived on the grounds. The professor of literature is investigating a mysterious chapter in the life of Byron. As their investigations unfold, the truth about what happened in Thomasina's lifetime is gradually revealed.

entryCosts.definition: Door sales only - Under 30 tickets, proof of age required

name: Devdas The Musical
description:
In true Bollywood style Devdas The Musical has a cast of 50 dazzling dancers, 15 instrumentalists, percussionists and vocalists. The stage will be ablaze with colour and sound with over 400 spectacular costumes adorned with intricate Indian jewellery.

Devdas is the story of childhood sweethearts Paro and Devdas separated due to the difference in their social status. Unable to bear the agony of a life without paro, Devdas turns to alcohol and Chandramukhi, a beautiful and rich courtesan who gives it all up for the love of a man who could never be hers.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Canberra City Band present Strike Up the Band!
description:
Come along and enjoy Australia's oldest community concert band. The Canberra City Band was first formed in 1925 to provide a musical outlet for the workers building Canberra. It reformed after the depression and World War Two, becoming fully orchestrated as a concert band in 1947.
A 45-piece flexible entertainment unit, the Canberra City Band has been awarded many major prizes.

Enjoy a blissful Sunday afternoon of music.

name: National Portrait Gallery Portraits on Sunday: In their own words
description:
Actor Tony Llewellyn-Jones and Karen Vickery, the Manager of Access and Learning at the National Portrait Gallery, bring to life moments in the diverse lives of subjects in the Gallery's Collection.

Join Tony and Karen as they read excerpts from diary entries, travel journals, speeches, poetry, novels and song lyrics.

name: Old Bus Depot Markets - Portobello Road
description:
Browse your way through the aisles of collectables and small antiques at the third and final Portobello Road event for the year.

Why visit? To fossick through an eclectic mix of quirky and interesting treasures. The fun is in the hunt as you never know what you might find amongst the stalls.

Stallholders and items you'll find: Rummage through a stack of old suitcases, funky lamp shades, tea cups and saucers and ceramic and glass flying ducks to decorate your home. Retro decorative art blends with antique jewellery, china and art glass, silver, linens and restored pieces.

name: About Face: the art of caricature
description:
About Face: the art of caricature features selected works of cartoonist John Frith who entertained Australians for over 60 years with his insightful and powerful depictions of political and public figures.

Political cartoons have always been a vibrant component of Australia's democracy and this exhibition celebrates the art and wit of caricature.

Alongside the Frith works are a collection of sculptures by David Rowe. This appealingly grotesque assortment was rescued from the garden shed and gives visitors an insight to the way in which the 2013 Political Cartoonist of the Year thinks and works.

name: Beauty & Strength: Portraits by Michael Riley
description: Michael Riley (1960 - 2004) a Wiradjuri and Kamilaroi man, photographer, film-maker and video-artist, is one of Australia's most influential Indigenous contemporary artists. These photographs taken between 1984 and 1990 are an intricately connected group portrait of the vibrant urban-based Indigenous arts community in Sydney's inner-west at a formative moment.

name: Beauty and strength - Michael Riley
description: Michael Riley (1960-2004) a Wiradjuri and Kamilaroi man, photographer, film-maker and video artist, is regarded as one of Australia's most influential Indigenous contemporary artists. The photographs taken between 1984 and 1990 are an intricately connected group portrait of the vibrant urban-based Indigenous arts community in Sydney's inner-west at a formative moment. This exhibition is on display until 17 August.

name: National Portrait Gallery Wednesday Gallery talk: Sand in the Hair
description:
Join Dr Sarah Engledow, Historian, at the National Portrait Gallery, as she introduces Arcadia: Sound of the sea.

Arcadia is an exhibition of lyrical, richly-textured photographs by John Witzig, co-founder of Tracks magazine and founder of SeaNotes, with huge ink drawings by Nicholas Harding and psychedelic film footage by Albert Falzon.

name: Screening: The Australian Biography Series- Peter Sculthorpe: Composer (1999)
description: The National Portrait Gallery will be screening The Australian Biography series - Peter Sculthorpe: Composer. Directed and interviewed by Robin Hughes as part of the Australian Biography series, the film shows composer Peter Sculthorpe reveal the strong influence that Australian history and its landscape has had on his work, how he expressed significant events in his life and his determination to create the perfect work of art.

name: Canberra Southern Cross Winter High Tea Cruises
description:
Experience an afternoon of elegance with a high tea aboard the M.V. Southern Cross. Enjoy a complimentary glass of sparkling, a tantalising selection of sweet and savoury treats and water views.

View Canberra's top lake side attractions from the warmth of the MV Southern Cross as you glide across picturesque Lake Burley Griffin on this special Saturday afternoon cruise.

Bookings are essential. Please check their website for more information.

Oscar Wilde's brilliant and much-loved comedy of love, manners and mistaken identity - The Importance of Being Earnest - has been delighting audiences for more than 100 years. Grand dame of the Australian theatre Nancye Hayes brings the formidable and acidic Lady Bracknell to life alongside the elastic and hilarious Nathan O'Keefe as Algernon.

Set within the stifling conventions of Victorian England, two young bachelors have taken to bending the rules and the truth to add a dash of excitement to their lives. See how it all unfolds.

Tickets from Canberra Ticketing. Booking fees may apply.

name: Kate Miller-Heidke
description:
Don't miss Kate Miller-Heidke - one of Australia's most talented and exciting live performers. This is your last chance to see Kate this year before she disappears overseas to headline in the UK and then perform for the prestigious New York Metropolitan Opera in The Death Of Klinghoffer.

Joining Kate in Canberra will be Ryan Keen. The UK singer-songwriter has a warm, breathy voice, technically virtuosic guitar playing style and armful of confessional and/or observational material.

Intimate Letters is a collaboration between the Australian Chamber Orchestra and Bell Shakespeare, led by London Symphony Orchestra concertmaster Gordan Nikolic.

Hear Mozart's Divertimento in F, K.138, Smetana's String Quartet No.1 - From My Life (arranged for string orchestra) and Janacek's String Quartet No.2 - Intimate Letters (arranged for string orchestra)

Gordan Nikolic Guest Director and Violin
Peter Evans Co-Artistic Director, Bell Shakespeare
Bell Shakespeare Actors
Australian Chamber Orchestra
Concept by Timo-Veikko Valve

name: Courtney Love - You know my name
description:
There is only one Courtney Love. The extraordinary music she created with Hole and on her own broke totally new ground. She's also a songwriter, actress, activist, celebrity and provocateur; a performer whose life and work are impossible to pigeonhole.

Catch her this August in Canberra.

Over 18s only. Tickets from Ticketek. Transaction fees from $4.95 per transaction apply.

name: A Bird in the Hand! Bob Graham: A Retrospective
description:
Bob Graham is one of Australia's most eminent authors. Don't miss this unique opportunity to see precious sketch books, manuscripts, memorabilia, and illustrations from books including Greetings from Sandy Beach; Max; Let's Get a Pup; and How to Heal a Broken Wing. These works and objects have been carefully selected from the artist's studio and from the Lu Rees Archives, University of Canberra, a treasure trove of Australian children's literature.

A vibrant place in the heart of the city, Canberra Museum and Gallery celebrates the region's social history and visual arts with dynamic exhibitions and unique programs and events.
address: Cnr London Circuit and Civic Square, Canberra City

name: Australian Gravity Enduro Series Race
description:
Stromlo Forest Park has been selected for the brand-new Australian Gravity Enduro Racing Series, joining a host of nation-wide venues.

This will be a multi-stage event that combines neutral cross-country climbs and transition zones and fast and flowy technical descends.

The Stromlo courses will have a big mix requiring some fitness, technical bike skills and a sense of adventure, providing an equal chance for all types of mountain bikers including cross country riders, weekend trail riders, and downhillers.

So get on your bike and register for this unique test of skill and endurance.

name: Elvis To The Max - The Orchestral Sessions
description:
Elvis To The Max will re-create the The Orchestral Sessions, proudly presented in Australia by Abstract Entertainment. There are lots of Elvis impersonators around, but Max Pellicano is considered as the best. In addition, Max's costumes are exact replicas made by Elvis' personal tailor Bill Bellow; making this a highly authentic show.

You'll enjoy an 18-piece orchestra and one of the world's first and most-successful Elvis impersonators, whose uncanny resemblance and equally chilling performance has mesmerised Australians over the last two decades.

name: Exhibition Talk: Remarkable Voyages and Scenes  from Colonial Life
description:
The Treasures Gallery showcases some of the Library's most memorable items and Australia's best-known stories.
James and Bettison Treasures Curator Nat Williams will reveal new items in the Treasures Gallery, including Bennelong's 1796 letter, the first known writing by an Indigenous Australian, and Moses Griffith's rainbow lorikeet watercolour from 1772.

name: Mark Vincent
description:
Mark Vincent won the third series of 'Australia's Got Talent' in 2009. His voice has a depth and clarity which belie his years.

His first album My Dream (Mio Visione) captured the hearts of many, then he delivered again with Compass and again with The Great Tenor Songbook. Now, with his fourth highly-anticipated instalment entitled Songs From The Heart Mark is back and sounding even more breathtaking.

Tickets to these one off, intimate shows are selling fast, so book now.

name: Bob Dylan
description:
Bob Dylan. How does one begin to describe the monumental impact his presence has made on popular culture? Talking about 50+ album releases and a career spanning six decades barely scratches the surface. Perhaps Dylan's most impactful achievement though, is his timeless ability to remain relevant; deftly crossing multiple generations.

Tickets from Ticketek. Transaction fees from $4.95 per transaction apply.

name: Highway of Lost Hearts
description:
Highway of Lost Hearts is a play about a woman, a dog, a campervan and 4,500 kilometres of wide open road.

Mot wakes up one morning to find that her heart is missing from her chest. She can breathe; she has a pulse - but she feels...nothing.

She decides to go and look for it. With her Dog enlisted as her co-pilot, Mot heads down the Highway of Lost Hearts. Into the deepest core of the Australian outback - navigating red dirt landscapes, fire and flood, vast salt lakes, age-old mountains and murky waters filled with lost souls.

name: Flights of fashion:The performer and the portrait: How portraiture inspires character and costume
description:
Set and costume designer Julie Lynch, discusses how portraiture inspires character and costume designs. Julie reveals the way portraiture is a rich resource for costume design as part of the Flights of Fashion series.

Flights of Fashion is a series of talks on the importance of fashion in portraiture, exploring topics from headwear to underwear.

name: Fireside Festival
description:
Venues around the Canberra region turn up the heat in August for the capital's annual celebration of winter - Fireside Festival.

Sip on exquisite cool climate wines, taste the delicacies from the region, meet local artists with a passion for their craft, or just relax and warm yourself on open fires in the company of good friends.

Attend a 100 mile dinner. Enjoy a couples relaxation escape. Try dinners of the duck, truffle or degustation variety. Attend a wine master class and lots more.

Hosted by over 20 venues in and around Canberra, check their website for details.

name: The Truffle Festival, Canberra & Capital Region
description:
Discover the magic of black truffles at The Truffle Festival. The Canberra and capital region celebrates the local harvest of these highly prized gems from 21st June to late August.

Learn from celebrity chefs and other truffle experts. Join a truffle hunt, take a cooking class, or indulge in the special flavours and intoxicating aromas of truffle dishes at local restaurants, cafes and wineries. Try breakfasts and lunches or immerse yourself in the grandeur of this exquisite delicacy with sumptuous truffle degustation dinners at various fine dining restaurants.

With more than 60 participating venues, there is much to explore!

name: National Portrait Gallery Collection Highlights Gallery Tour
description:
Join the National Portrait Gallery educators on a highlights tour of the collection galleries. This is a great opportunity to learn more about the collection and the building as you explore the Galleries.

The National Portrait Gallery educators will provide insight into the collection on display and highlight facts or elements that you may not have noticed or previously known.

name: Icehouse
description:
With a career spanning over 30 years, Icehouse has continued to delight millions with their music, well-known and loved by audiences across generations. Icehouse has played to sell-out audiences in Australia and toured extensively. Icehouse began in 1977 as a Sydney-based pub rock band called Flowers, who were the highest paid unsigned act in Australia at the time.

Head back to your youth, or discover some iconic Aussie rock. Tickets to these one off, intimate shows are selling fast, so book now.

Oz Opera's The Magic Flute is a ripping yarn for all the family. This new production transforms Mozart's final work into a rollicking adventure set in 1930s Egypt.

There is something for everyone in The Magic Flute - from the Queen of the Night's demented showstoppers, to achingly beautiful arias, to simple ballads that wrap you up in warmth and charm.

The Magic Flute will be sung in English and performed with a chamber orchestra.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Tina Arena - Reset
description:
Don't miss your chance to see Australian pop icon Tina Arena light up the room on her Reset Tour!

Tina Arena is a name that's synonymous with Australian music and pop culture. Her voice has resonated throughout generations. Her early days were on Young Talent Time. She came of age with her debut album Strong as Steel. Tina had incredible international success with ten times platinum Don't Ask and follow up multi platinum In Deep, and then again with 2001's Just Me. Reset is her first original English language release in 12 years.

Tickets from Ticketek. Fees apply.

name: Mohona performing at the High Court
description: Mohona consists of Robin Guda, a virtuoso Indian classical singer from Bangladesh, percussionist Andrew Purdam and Australia's foremost bansuri (bamboo flute) player, Nitya Parker. Their music, a mixture of original and traditional compositions, truly colours minds and hearts. It celebrates the wonders of nature and the sacredness of all life.

name: Rolling Thunder Vietnam: Songs that defined a generation
description:
Don't miss the powerful new Australian concert drama Rolling Thunder Vietnam. This dynamic theatrical concert draws audiences inside the lives of men on the Vietnam War battlefront and their family and loved ones at home.

The show features the music of Steppenwolf, Joe Cocker, Buffalo Springfield, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Gladys Knight, Billy Thorpe, The Rolling Stones and Curtis Mayfield. See it performed by Wes Carr, Kimberley Hodgson, Tom Oliver, Matt Pearce, Vanessa Krummenacher and Will Ewing under the esteemed music direction of Chong Lim (Dancing With The Stars, John Farnham Band).

Transaction fees may apply.

Join Dora and the rest of her friends in Dora's Pirate Adventure as they embark on an exciting trip to Treasure Island in search of the ultimate pirate party. Help them navigate over Dancing Mountain and through Silly Singing Bridge in pursuit of the Pirate Piggies. Along the way, Dora the Explorer fans will use their map-reading, counting, musical and language skills to successfully help Dora reach Treasure Island and avoid that pesky fox Swiper!

name: Joseph and Jones Racing Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Free admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to the public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a luncheon from the black board menu in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

Thoroughbred Park welcomes Joseph and Jones Racing to their race day luncheon in the Silks Room.

name: Rocky Trail Shimano MTB Grand Prix Round 5
description:
What better place to enjoy the beautiful spring surrounds of Canberra than Stromlo Forest Park and race the "Enduro MTB series finale that rocks"?

The fifth and final round of Rocky Trail's Shimano Mountain Bike Grand Prix series will be held at Stromlo Forest Park. See or join Australia's best mountain bike endurance racers competing for four or seven hours.

Options to race solo or in teams are offered. Explore some of the best mountain bike trails in Australia yourself!

Bring your family - there will be free kids' races and plenty of activities! Free spectator entry.

entryCosts.definition: Solo race entries start at $75; team entries and junior concessions offered.

name: The Dream
description:
The clue is in the title, but this a different dream. Peter Evans will reawaken Shakespeare's classic A Midsummer Night's Dream with a breathless 90-minute production that amplifies the magic, mirth and mayhem.

Fast, funny and family friendly, this Bell Shakespeare version of The Dream is as you've never seen it before.

Tickets from Canberra Ticketing. Booking fees may apply.

name: Gunning Fireworks Festival 2014
description:
The Gunning Fireworks Festival has become one of the most popular family events in the area. The fireworks finale will showcase the latest in high tech effects during a massive pyrotechnical musical sky show.

Stallholders will be there to tempt you with locally handmade products plus food, drinks and entertainment.

The event is produced by Fireworks Australia who have a factory in the region. Fireworks Australia supply specialised products to other fireworks companies, film and television, touring productions and major events Australia wide.

A Place to Call Home - Migrant Hostel Memories. Nissen huts, boiled mutton, bottled milk and helping hands. For many migrants after World War II, for better or worse, hostels were their first 'homes'. Short or long term, good or bad, hostel life was always memorable.

Rekindle memories with vivid photographs of life in Australia's migrant hostels. Unfamiliar sights, sounds and food. Friendships formed, challenges faced. The beginnings of a new life in Australia.

This project has been assisted by the Australian Government through the Australia Council for the Arts, its arts funding and advisory body.

Not Dead Yet traces four decades of powerful and persuasive graphic art from the original 1970s 'hotbed' of protest art - the Tin Sheds at Sydney University - through to the present day. Developed by Anita Angel, curator of the Charles Darwin University Art Collection and Art Gallery, the exhibition features screen prints, posters, drawings, photographs, digital collage works and limited edition fine art prints and paintings.

A vibrant place in the heart of the city, Canberra Museum and Gallery celebrates the region's social history and visual arts with dynamic exhibitions and unique programs and events.
address: Cnr London Circuit and Civic Square, Canberra City

name: Alison Alder: Carcass
description:
Alison Alder has a strong background in the production of political posters. This experience directly informs the work comprising this exhibition, which features the artist's suite of prints, 'Carcass', 2009, from the CMAG collection.

Alder is one of the most accomplished artists in the Canberra region, having successfully combined dual careers as both artist and arts administrator - most recently as director of Megalo Print Studio + Gallery.

A vibrant place in the heart of the city, Canberra Museum and Gallery celebrates the region's social history and visual arts with dynamic exhibitions and unique programs and events.
address: Cnr London Circuit and Civic Square, Canberra City

name: Centenary Trail Blaze
description:
The Centenary Trail Blaze is a non-competitive cycling challenge on the Canberra Centenary Trail suitable for cyclists of all abilities. The off-road event offers ride options which include the full trail (160km), the southern section (65km) and a shuttle service for a shorter distance (35km).

This is a great way to see Canberra from a different angle and experience the scenic beauty of the Centenary Trail.

Entry fee includes a printed guidebook containing maps and highlighting points of interest along the route, water stops and marshalls to keep you on the right track.

name: Queen - It's A Kinda Magic
description:
Queen - It's A Kinda Magic delivers the whole Queen experience; from the passion and excitement of Freddie Mercury to the amazing guitar solos of Brian May and all those unbelievable harmonies.

Delivered with 21st century sound and lighting, Queen - It's A Kinda Magic creates the best of the 70's and 80's rock era in a way that will transport you in time.

Transaction fees apply.

entryCosts.definition: Transaction fee for this event $3.30 per transaction
Group 10+ (cost per person) - Transaction fee $3.30 per transaction

name: Queen - It's A Kinda Magic
description:
Queen - It's A Kinda Magic delivers the whole Queen experience; from the passion and excitement of Freddie Mercury to the amazing guitar solos of Brian May and all those unbelievable harmonies.

Delivered with 21st century sound and lighting, Queen - It's A Kinda Magic creates the best of the 70's and 80's rock era in a way that will transport you in time.

Transaction fees apply.

entryCosts.definition: Group 10+ (cost per person) - Transaction fee $3.30 per transaction

name: Ranamok 2014
description:
Ranamok Glass Prize 2014 is the twentieth year of this prestigious Australian and New Zealand annual Glass Prize. The finalists' work in this prize is shown first at Canberra Glassworks where the winner is announced. This show captures the amazing range of artworks currently being made in glass from Australia and New Zealand.

Gallery Talk: Saturday, 17 August at 10.30am

name: Vintage Diamond - The Ultimate Neil Diamond Show
description:
Vintage Diamond perfectly recaptures the sound, songs and look of the era that was Neil Diamond. This performance is reminiscent to that of the legendary 1972 concert album Hot August Night. The Vintage Diamond show will take you back to the fabulous 1970's tours that gave rise to Neil Diamond's superstar status and ongoing popularity of worldwide hit songs.

Transaction fees apply.

name: Diesel Lit Up: The Singles Tour 89-14
description:
After 25 years of music making, Diesel leaves his front door again to bring you Diesel Lit Up - The Singles 89-14. This tour looks back at the sparks of the accumulated singles that have etched their way into our musical landscape.

With over 30 singles and 13 albums, expect a performance littered with milestones and familiar songs taking on a new life in an uncluttered solo environment.

name: The Idea Of North: Stagecraft Workshop
description:
Learn the art of live performance with The Idea of North

Hear some of the group's stories of life on the road and what they've learnt along the way. They will share techniques in harmony singing, stagecraft and teach you a brand new song.

If you have tickets to their evening performance at The Street Theatre you will be invited to perform the song with TION, live on stage that night!

This workshop will give you hands on experience working closely with TION. Places are limited. Special packages and group discounts are available. See website for details.

name: The Idea Of North: Limelight
description:
The Idea of North (TION) return to The Street Theatre for the first time this year to perform Limelight.
Sample a selection of TION's brand new a cappella arrangements including new selections from some of their favourite artists and a smattering of songs from their much-loved repertoire.

TION will also be holding a Stagecraft workshop that afternoon. Special packages are available for those who wish to attend both the afternoon workshop and the evening Limelight concert. Group discounts are available, so gather your friends and come to one or both!

Limelight + Stagecraft package available. See website for details.

name: The Gospel Folk Choir: Raise your voice, raise your spirit
description: A mixed four part choir, led by Brian Triglone, The Gospel Folk choir have been bringing the joy of contemporary gospel, folk and other popular music to the people of Canberra since 2001. The choir gives concerts and performs at public events such as citizenship ceremonies and Floriade, and has twice been invited to sing at the Bali memorial services in The Great Hall at Parliament House. In 2013 the choir performed at the Arboretum, the High Court of Australia and the Belconnen Arts Centre as part of The Musical Offering celebrating Canberra's centenary.

name: RedAss NSW/ACT Downhill State Round
description:
Stromlo Forest Park will be hosting round two of the 2014 RedAss NSW/ACT Downhill State Series. More than 150 riders are expected to compete on the World Cup Track for valuable series points.

This is a very spectator-friendly event - come and see some of the most talented downhill riders and how they tackle the challenging Stromlo downhill track. Practice will be all day Saturday and racing will commence on Sunday. Shuttle bus transport will run on both days and is included in the entry fee.

Bookings essential, please see the website for further details..

entryCosts.definition: Early bird $110 for adult race categories, junior and U17 discounts offered. Late registration $130. See website for details.

name: Old Bus Depot Markets - Green Savvy Sunday
description:
Participate in Canberra's interactive market which brings together products and community groups focused on domestic green sustainable living.

Why visit? Discover the latest in green technology for the home environment, buy specialist green/sustainable products, and speak to a variety of government agencies and companies about what programs, assistance and products they provide to the community and householders.

Stallholders and items you'll find: Products made using low energy, organic techniques or recycled materials, delicious organic food to enjoy, information on relevant initiatives.

name: ACTTAB Tony Campbell Memorial Cup
description:
ACTTAB and other high profile Canberra business people celebrate the life of a true friend of racing, Tony Campbell, who lost his battle with cancer in 2006.

Join them and book into the official luncheon for a great day of horse racing and entertainment and special guests. Call the Administration office for tickets.

Free admission into the racecourse.

Book a table in the Members only Black Opal Room or enjoy the superb bar facilities of the Winning Post Bar.

name: The Gruffalo
description:
Whether your favourite food is roasted fox, owl ice cream, scrambled snake or Gruffalo crumble, you'll eat up this delectable tale about the adventures of a clever little mouse in a forest full of predators. Join Mouse on his adventurous journey through the deep, dark wood.

Mouse can scare hungry animals away with tall stories of the terrifying Gruffalo, but what happens when she comes face to face with the very creature she imagined?

Let your imagination run wild with songs, laughs and fun for children aged three and up, and their adults.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: SCOTT Australian 24 Hour Mountain Bike Championships
description:
Head to Stromlo Forest Park to see adrenaline pumping at the SCOTT Australian 24 Hour Mountain Bike Championships.

Watch teams battling it out against the terrain, the clock and each other with the aim of completing the most laps.

The world's largest 24 hour mountain bike race gives riders of all skill levels the chance to participate in a competitive and fun environment.

name: Floriade NightFest
description: When the sun sets on Commonwealth Park, Floriade NightFest will shine a light on Australia's biggest celebration of spring. From live music, stand-up comedy and hip DJs to cocktails, night markets and beautifully lit garden beds, Floriade NightFest will transform the park into an illuminated wonderland over five magical nights.

name: Governors-General: from our collection
description:
This small exhibition; 'Govenor General: from our collection', highlights items from our collection, and looks at the role and impact of the Governor-General in our society. The exhibition has been timed to celebrate the outgoing Governor-General, Dame Quentin Bryce, and the arrival of her successor, General Sir Peter Cosgrove into the office.

In the forefront of the exhibition is the museum's most recent acquisition - the yellow woollen dress suit worn by Dame Quentin Bryce when, as Governor-General, she swore in Julia Gillard as Australia's first female Prime Minister in June 2010.

name: The Harbinger
description:
The Harbinger is an enchanting adult fairytale by Queensland's inimitable Dead Puppet Society that melds live performance, puppetry, animation and stage trickery to create a richly magical world where the lines between reality and make-believe fall away. The Harbinger is a gothic tale of solitude, heartbreak and of a time long forgotten.

Part puppet show, part storybook, part daydream, The Harbinger is a classic tale of heroes and villains, centred on a little girl and an old man who find themselves thrown together in the aftermath of civil war.

A critical stages + The Hayloft Project Production

name: The Llewellyn Choir at the High Court
Handmade Market October
description:
Canberra's award winning Handmade Market brings together talented artists, designers, stylists, craftspeople and gourmets all under one roof.

The Handmade Market is held at the National Convention Centre and will showcase over 150 Australian designer/makers. Each event will showcase local and interstate designers with new talent on display at each event.

All products on sale at the Handmade Market are Australian made and designed. Shop with us and find something unique, well priced and support Australian designers.

name: Canberra Saengerfest 2014
description:
Come and enjoy the 16th Australian Saengerfest. A festival of German speaking music which takes place in Canberra.

Delight in the sounds of over 400 choristers from 23 choirs, from all States and the ACT, who will perform in a massed choir concert.

Saengerfest performances are open to the public, a truly unique experience not to be missed!

Tickets available from Ticketek. Booking fee's may apply.

The Sesame Street gang have circled the globe and now bring this popular musical show back to Australia! Don't miss Elmo, Abby, Cadabby, Big Bird, Grover, Zoe, Bert and Ernie, Cookie Monster and The Count live on stage as they use letters of the alphabet to navigate a voyage through imagination! Sesame Street presents Elmo's World Tour is sure to delight fans of all ages!

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Youth Care Race Day and Students Race Day
description:
Enjoy an afternoon of racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park. Free admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

Join students from Canberra's five tertiary institutions. Have a fun day out including Fashions on the Field competitions and entertainment.

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a carvery luncheon in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

.

name: Floriade
description: Floriade, the national capital's annual flagship tourism event, is the largest floral festival in the Southern Hemisphere. Each year in September visitors are invited to celebrate the arrival of spring with a 30-day celebration featuring cooking demonstrations, gardening tips, recreational activities for kids and families, entertainment and horticultural workshops all peppered with some high profile celebrities to add some spice. Set amongst Canberra's Commonwealth Park on the picturesque shores of Lake Burley Griffin, Floriade's four-hectare site is filled with over a million blooms in a variety of themed garden beds designed to fit within an overarching theme each year.

name: Old Bus Depot Markets - Retro Depot
description:
Dust off your platforms, get off the Featherston, and channel your inner hipster. Get along to Retro Depot at the Old Bus Depot Markets this Spring.

Retro Depot is a celebration of all things retro cool. Browse fashion, homewares, furniture, jewellery and accessories that are all designed to push your 'groove button'.

name: Tuliptop Gardens Festival, The
description:
Drive into Spring at the Tuliptop Gardens Festival. Their 10 acre garden of tulips, daffodils, and other spring flowers creates a spectacular display. Hundreds of blossom trees provide a magic pathway to the cascading waterfall and watercourse. Classical music wafts through the air in the hidden valley. Walk past the rosemary field to the 70 metre high viewing platform for the perfect photo.

Enjoy a picnic and bottle of wine in the grounds.

Tulip Top Gardens is 15 minutes from Canberra on the Federal Highway.

Check their website for full details. Entry fees apply.

name: Rick Springfield
description:
Rick Springfield, Grammy award-winning musician, actor and New York Times best selling author is back to rock Canberra in October this year.

The iconic Australian rock star who has sold over 25 million records with a whopping 17 top-40 hits has been touring for more than 30 years. His shows are legendary for their rock heavy, high energy, full band sets and classic song lists.

Tickets from Ticketek. Transaction fees from $4.95 per transaction apply.

name: Canberra Latin Dance Festival 2014
description:
If you love Latin music and dancing, don't miss the Canberra Latin Dance Festival! The festival brings together leading international, national and local talent to perform, teach and celebrate the Latin dance phenomenon. There's two days of first class workshops and three nights of breathtaking performances and amazing dance parties.

Canberra Latin Dance Festival is headlined by some of the world's finest Latin dancers.

The festival will also be holding a free dance week, a week before the festival, to give everyone an opportunity to learn some Latin dancing.

Check their website for full details.

name: Heart and Soul Singers & Aranda Community Choir at the High Court
description: The Heart and Soul Singers came together in August 2009 to promote the health benefits of singing for the 'over 50s'.  Their aim is to provide socialization, companionship and physical and mental activity through the joy of singing. Joining with the Aranda Community Choir, led by Tim Bevitt, both choirs will share their love of music by singing a wide variety of material from all over the world. A concert for children, parents, grandparents and friends.

name: Tidbinbilla Extravaganza
description:
Tidbinbilla Extravaganza is a great day in the beautiful setting of Sheedys Picnic area at Tidbinbilla Nature Reserve with fun for the whole family. Talk to staff about the Endangered Species Breeding Program, participate in Indigenous activities, enjoy live entertainment, ride on a horse-drawn carriage, or talk to Pioneers.

Pack a picnic, have a barbeque or purchase food from stalls.

Tidbinbilla Nature Reserve is home to a wide range of Australian animals including kangaroos, platypus, potoroos, wallaroos, possums, wombats, echidnas, emus, lyrebirds and many other birds and reptiles.

Book your favourite people in now for a fun day out.
address: RMB 141 Paddy's River Road, via Tharwa, Tidbinbilla

name: Growing up in Downer
description:
Using historical material from the Ault Family Collection, 'Growing up in Downer' tells the story of Christina Ault's childhood, adolescence and early adulthood. Kept safe in a tea chest and a cabin trunk for many years, this material gives a rich insight into a family, a suburb, and the growing city of Canberra.

A vibrant place in the heart of the city, Canberra Museum and Gallery celebrates the region's social history and visual arts with dynamic exhibitions and unique programs and events.
address: Cnr London Circuit and Civic Square, Canberra City

description:
Stylish, funny, and tender, La Fille Mal Gardee will put a spiring in your step and a smile on your face.

Lise loves Colas. Colas loves Lise. But Lise's mother, the Widow Simone, has agreed that her wayward daughter should marry Alain, son of a pompous, wealthy vineyard owner. Alain however, is more interested in his precious umbrella than romance.

A popular family favourite because of its simple, engaging story and colourful humour, this stunning new production, set in 1950's rural France, will leave you applauding for more.

Transaction fees apply.

name: Llewellyn Series 14.4 Rodrigo Canberra Symphony Orchestra
description:
Canberra Symphony Orchestra's concert, supported by the Embassy of Spain, features warm Iberian textures expertly realised through the baton of Nicholas Milton. To start: Richard Strauss' extraordinary tone poem, Don Juan. Lusciously extravagant and intimately tender, Don Juan takes you on a deeply emotional journey.

Continue the Spanish sojourn with renowned Australian guitarist Karin Schaupp and the effervescent, transcendentally moving Concierto de Aranjuez.

Finally hear the massive, iconic Beethoven's Fifth. This work continuously redefines the concept of artistic immortality and destiny and is a pure manifestation of the emotional power of symphonic music.

name: Ray White Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Free admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to the public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a carvery luncheon in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

name: Brian Cox - Making Sense of the Cosmos
description:
Brian Cox - Making Sense of the Cosmos take you on a dazzling journey through space and time, at times delving into 'high science' and at others freewheeling on the edges of the known cosmos. Always captivating, continually surprising and forever pushing the boundaries, see Cox take science to a new dimension in this new stage show.
