Brian Cox is the UK's, and perhaps the worlds, foremost communicator of all things scientific. He has the innate ability to make highly complex matters enormously entertaining and easy to contemplate.

Tickets from Ticketek. Transaction fees from $4.95 per transaction apply.

name: National Portrait Gallery: Arcadia Highlights tour
description:
Join the National Portrait Gallery educators on a highlights tour of the exhibition: Arcadia Sound of the sea.

Arcadia is an exhibition of lyrical, richly-textured photographs by John Witzig, co-founder of Tracks magazine and founder of SeaNotes, with huge ink drawings by Nicholas Harding and psychedelic film footage by Albert Falzon. Imbued with a romantic conception of the awesome and spiritually restorative force of the sea, it expresses the free-spirited, revolutionary character of a group of young and perfectly-formed Australian surfers in the early 1970s.

Exhibition ticket needed.

name: Arcadia: Sound of the Sea
description:
Arcadia is an exhibition of lyrical, richly-textured photographs by John Witzig, co-founder of Tracks magazine and founder of SeaNotes, with huge ink drawings by Nicholas Harding and psychedelic film footage by Albert Falzon.

Imbued with a romantic conception of the awesome and spiritually restorative force of the sea, Arcadia expresses the free-spirited, revolutionary character of a group of young and perfectly-formed Australian surfers in the early 1970s.

name: Seventh Wonder: The Fleetwood Mac Experience
description:
Seventh Wonder - The Fleetwood Mac Experience celebrates the 40th anniversary of the birth of the classic Fleetwood Mac line-up. For Mac fans across the country this is a tribute production that will recreate, and allow them to experience, the sound and the feel that was Fleetwood Mac in their prime.

The tribute show will take you on a live concert journey through their timeless classic songs that span four decades including their worldwide hits Rhiannon, Don't Stop, Go Your Own Way, Dreams, Tusk, Sara, Gypsy, The Chain, Landslide, Big Love and Little Lies.

Transaction fees may apply.

Richard Tognetti directs Beethoven's Symphony No.1, Coriolan-Overture and Triple Concerto plus a new work, Water, by Radiohead's Jonny Greenwood.

JONNY GREENWOOD Water [Australian premiere]
BEETHOVEN Coriolan - Overture
BEETHOVEN Symphony No.1
BEETHOVEN Triple Concerto

Richard Tognetti Director and Violin
Timo-Veikko Valve Cello
Yevgeny Sudbin Piano
Australian Chamber Orchestra

The Australian Chamber Orchestra's recent Beethoven concerts have been reviewed with enormous enthusiasm: "[ACO] play particularly well when the fire is in their belly, and nobody puts it there like Beethoven." (Sydney Morning Herald)

name: Diplomatic Notes and Fiscal Harmony join Rhythm Syndicate at the High Court
description: Singers from the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (Diplomatic Notes) and the Department of Finance and Deregulation (Fiscal Harmony) take a break from their desks to  join Rhythm Syndicate in a celebration of music from the four corners of the earth.  Exploring a  variety of musical styles, from jazz and gospel to popular and classical numbers, both accompanied and a cappella, this concert is guaranteed to lift the roof.

name: August Osage County
description:
Winner of the 2007 Pulitzer Prize, Tracy Letts' black comedy/drama August: Osage County continues to receive high critical acclaim from both critics and audiences alike.

August: Osage County is set on the plains of modern day, middle-class Oklahoma. The Weston family members are all intelligent, sensitive creatures who have the uncanny ability of making each other absolutely miserable. When the patriarch of the household mysteriously vanishes, the damaged Weston clan gathers together to simultaneously support and mercilessly attack one another.

Transaction fees may apply.

name: Perception Deception
description:
Does your brain play tricks on you? Is one person's reality the same as yours? Answer these questions and more with the Perception Deception exhibition at Questacon. Surprise your senses and challenge your mind with over 60 hands-on and multimedia exhibits featuring perceptual test and illusions.

This family-friendly exhibition reveals how our brains process information from our senses to form our perception of the world around us. Sometimes all is not as it seems!

entryCosts.definition: 2 adults and 3 children. $8.00 each for additional children

name: ACTTAB Melbourne Cup Race Day
description:
Come to Thoroughbred Park to see the race that stops the nation on the big screen!

Enjoy local thoroughbred horse racing on the course proper.

The Myer Fashions on the Field will be run on the day with some great prizes. Release your inner show pony and dress the part!

Hospitality packages available for all budgets - from picnics to corporate entertaining!

name: Anh Do - The Happiest Refugee
description:
Anh Do's bestselling book The Happiest Refugee has made readers laugh and cry. Anh's stage show takes it a step further, combining stand-up comedy with real life stories, photos and filmed pieces to retell his amazing story.

When one of Australia's most talented comedians delves deep into his own life's joys and sorrows, the result is an unforgettable night at the theatre that leaves you uplifted and quite simply ... experiencing happiness.

Tickets from Canberra Ticketing. Transaction fees apply.

name: Old Bus Depot Markets - The Jewel of Canberra
description:
Step inside a giant jewellery box for the day with exquisite works from some of the region's best jewellery designers and artists.

Why visit? To browse the many jewellery stalls and find a unique handcrafted piece of jewellery to make you stand out from the crowd. You'll find a large range of jewellery styles, price points and individual pieces because the stallholders are all independent designers and craftspeople who work within a small business environment.

Stallholders and items you'll find: Jewellery made from silver, recycled metal art, pearls, precious and semi precious stones, resin, glass, ceramics and much more.

name: 18th Canberra International Film Festival
description:
Now in its 18th year, the Canberra International Film Festival celebrates cinema across an 18-day program, showcasing extraordinary films from around the globe.

The Canberra International Film Festival believes in the power of cinema to tell the stories of our many cultures. In 2013 audiences flocked to devoured 62 films from 31 countries.

In addition to screening feature films and documentaries, you can enjoy QandA sessions, and panel discussions with directors, producers, actors and the broad range of artists involved in the filmmaking process.

Films at Dendy Cinema and the National Film and Sound Archive's Arc Cinema.
address: Level 2, North Quarter, Bunda Street, Canberra City

name: Let all Men Sing!
description:
Let all Men Sing! is a rare treat for choral music lovers. Hear massed voices from fifteen Australian and New Zealand male choirs and Australia's elite military band. Enjoy the big choir in four part harmony singing a fine variety of songs - spirituals, operatic, Australian, contemporary and a Welsh hymn.

Let all Men Sing! features the outstanding Band of the Royal Military College Duntroon, playing their own program and accompanying the choir.

Concert directed by distinguished Guest Conductor Dr Guy Jansen from New Zealand.

Save the date now. Tickets due to go on sale in July.

name: Polifemy perform olyphonic sacred music at the High Court
description: Polifemy is a small female vocal ensemble founded by Joan Milner and now directed by Robyn Mellor. The ensemble specialises in Medieval and Renaissance polyphonic sacred music that has been written or adapted for or by nuns. Polifemy revel in the challenges and pleasures of singing this often complex repertoire. Most of the performances will be unaccompanied but some will be augmented by recorders and bass viola da gamba. Within the High Court's cathedral like architectural spaces this promises to be a uniquely beautiful performance.

The cartoon exhibition; Behind the Lines tells the tale of three Australian leaders; Gillard, Rudd and Abbott. See them through broken parliamentary alliances, caucus instability, and leadership spills, prime ministerial changes, corruption scandals, cabinet reshuffles, policies and opinion polls. You've never seen a year like this in politics!

Download the Behind the Lines app for either your Android or Apple device. The exhibition app includes audio description of the exhibition's cartoons in several different languages.

name: Zine Lounge
description:
Check out the new Zine Lounge! Let your imagination run wild in this self-guided workshop, with all supplies and materials provided to make your own zine.

A zine (pronounced 'zeen') is a handmade, self-published magazine, often photocopied in black and white, and with a limited print run.

The range of subjects is as diverse as the people who make them. Zines can be about absolutely anything! Print is powerful

name: Watershed: Lake Burley Griffin 1964 -2014
description:
Watershed: Lake Burley Griffin 1964 -2014 celebrates the 50th anniversary of the inauguration of Lake Burley Griffin. It touches lightly on a time before the lake then explores the design and creation of Lake Burley Griffin and its special place in the heart of the Canberra community.

A vibrant place in the heart of the city, Canberra Museum and Gallery celebrates the region's social history and visual arts with dynamic exhibitions and unique programs and events.
address: Cnr London Circuit and Civic Square, Canberra City

name: Rick Astley - Together Forever
description:
Rick Astley is back with his amazing band with the Together Forever tour. You'll get to hear all the global hits that made Rick a household name and a few musical surprises along the way.

Never Gonna Give You Up, Whenever You Need Somebody, When I Fall In Love, Together Forever, She Wants To Dance With Me and Cry For Help helped him sell over 40 million records.

Rick continues to deliver outstanding live performances gaining the accolades of both long time fans and hardened critics alike.

Tickets from Canberra Ticketing. Transaction fees apply.

name: ANZAC voices
description:
Marking the centenary of the First World War, this exhibition features treasures from the Australian War Memorial's archives. The voices of the ANZACs will be presented through their letters and diaries.

What the Australians endured on Gallipoli and the Western Front, in the mud of Flanders and the deserts of Sinai-Palestine, was almost indescribably horrific and can never be fully comprehended by those who did not fight in these campaigns or witness them at first hand.

Hear the voices of the ANZACs.

Exhibition runs until the redeveloped First World War galleries open in late November 2014.

name: Voices in the Forest
description:
Voices in the Forest is a spectacular outdoor operatic concert held in the natural amphitheatre at the National Arboretum. This year's concert features Latvian soprano Inessa Galante, Australian Baritone Peter Coleman-Wright and New Zealand Tenor Simon O'Neill.

Whether your preference is to be seated theatre-style, or to relax with friends and family enjoying a picnic on the grass, Voices in the Forest promises to be a delightful event for everyone.

Check their website for full details.

Tickets through Canberra Ticketing.
address: Forest Drive, Off Tuggeranong Parkway, Yarralumla

name: Worldly Goods performing at the High Court
description: Worldly Goods is a Canberra-based world music community choir. It is non-auditioned, rarely uses scores and welcomes anyone and everyone. It began as a short-term project in 1998 and still going strong.  This concert offers the energetic and authentic sound of traditional songs from around the world in the grandeur of the High Court's building.

name: Handmade Market Christmas 2014
description:
Canberra's award winning Handmade Market brings together talented artists, designers, stylists, craftspeople and gourmets all under one roof.

The Handmade Market is held at the National Convention Centre and will showcase over 200 Australian designer/makers. Each event will feature local and interstate designers with new talent on display at each event. The Christmas Market is over two levels of the Convention Centre.

All products on sale at the Handmade Market are Australian made and designed. Shop at Handmade to support Australian designers and find something unique and well priced.

name: December Xmas Party Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park. Free general admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

Add to the atmosphere by booking into their festive Christmas party for the day (charges apply, bookings necessary)

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to the public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a carvery luncheon in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

name: Special Christmas Concert at the High Court
description: Helen Moore of 2013's The Musical Offering will direct and produce this concert modelled on a similar concert Musical Offering's produced for the Court on Sunday 15 December 2013.  Including high profile Canberra singers along with Canberra's best choirs and musical groups, this will be an uplifting Christmas concert for the whole family.  A beautiful celebration of and a conclusion to the Court's 2014 concert program.

name: National Gallery of Australia talks and workshops
description:
The National Gallery of Australia has an extensive program of talks and workshops run in conjunction with their current exhibitions.

Hear about local and international artists or specific techniques.

Be inspired by the greats and create your own artworks.

Talks and workshops cater for a range of different age groups. Check their website for full details.

name: National Capital Exhibition daily tour
description:
Make this new free tour your first stop on any visit to the National Capital.

This brief guided tour will introduce you to the story of Canberra - from pre-history, Federation and the development of a fully planned city through to the future.

What is the role of a capital? What national institutions can you visit?

Why was the Capital sited where it is and who made the final decision on that? Who were Walter Burley Griffin and his wife Marion?

Why are there so many roundabouts and no skyscrapers?

Discover all this and more.

name: Korea Republic v Oman: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015
description:
See Korea Republic v Oman as part of the AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 in Canberra!

Korea Republic, also known as the Taeguk Warriors, are ranked 4th among Asian football teams. Korea Republic played against Russia, Algeria and Belgium in the 2014 World Cup. They're ranked 57th. They've won the Asian Cup twice and come second three times.

FIFA ranks Oman 82nd. This is their third attempt at the Cup. Oman reached the Gulf Cup of Nations final three times and won on their third attempt. Will three continue as their lucky number?

Tickets on sale now.

name: UAE v Qatar: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015
description:
See UAE v Qatar as part of the AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 in Canberra! Tickets on sale now.

United Arab Emirates (UAE) took fourth place in the 1992 Asian Cup and runner-up in 1996. In both tournaments their final match was lost on penalty kicks. The team is currently ranked 7 amongst the Asian nations and 67th in the FIFA world rankings.

Qatar has appeared in seven AFC Asian Cup tournaments. The national team played its first match against Bahrain in the Gulf Cup. Qatar is ranked 95th in the world. They're hosting the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

name: Kuwait v Korea Republic: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015
description:
See Kuwait v Korea Republic as part of the AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 in Canberra! Tickets on sale now.

Kuwait's team won the Gulf Cup in 1996 and 1998 before securing their record 10th title in 2010. Their FIFA world ranking is 108th.

Korea Republic are 55th in the FIFA world ranking. In the 2011 AFC Asian Cup they defeated Iran, lost out to Japan in a penalty shoot-out in the semi-finals. Korea Republic defeated Uzbekistan 3-2 and won third place for the second Asian Cup in a row.

name: Bahrain v UAE: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015
description:
See Bahrain v UAE as part of the AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 in Canberra! Tickets on sale now.

Bahrain is ranked 105th in the world. In 2004 they were awarded FIFA's most improved team after finishing 4th in the 2004 Asian Cup.

United Arab Emirates (UAE) are 72nd in the FIFA world ranking. The UAE has qualified for one World Cup. They won the Gulf Cup for the first time in 2007.

name: China PR v DPR Korea: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015
description:
See China PR v DPR Korea as part of the AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 in Canberra! Tickets on sale now.

China PR is 103rd in the FIFA world rankings. They won the East Asian Cup in 2005 and 2010. China also appeared in the 2002 FIFA World Cup.

DPR Korea qualified for the 2010 FIFA World Cup. North Korea has qualified for the AFC Asian Cup five times. The current team is composed of native North Koreans and Chongryon-affiliated Koreans born in Japan. Their FIFA world ranking is 146.

name: Iraq v Palestine: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015
description:
See Iraq v Palestine as part of the AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 in Canberra! Tickets on sale now.

Iraq's FIFA world ranking is 104th. On 5 March 2014, they booked their Asian Cup spot with a commanding 3-1 win at the Sharjah Stadium against China. Veteran Younis Mahmoud contributed two goals and Ali Adnan one.

Palestine won the 2014 AFC Challenge Cup without conceding a goal and drawing just one out of five games. The win brought the Palestine team their first major trophy and their first Asian Cup entry.

name: Bidvest Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of summer horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Bidvest Race Day is a free admission day out for all the family. See eight races. Bar and snack food facilities available.

Free parking.

Gates open approximately 12 noon.

name: AFC Asian Cup Australia 2015 Quarter Final
Happy and Glorious
description:
Happy and Glorious celebrates the 60th anniversary of Queen Elizabeth II's first visit to Australia in 1954.

Explore the significance of the royal visit for Australia and Canberra by taking a walk in the royal footsteps through Old Parliament House to see the exhibition displays. Finish your 'royal tour' by viewing the replica crown jewels, now on display.

name: Belconnen Magpies Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Free admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to the public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a carvery luncheon in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

name: ICC Cricket World Cup 2015: Bangladesh v Afghanistan
description:
The ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 is coming to the nation's capital! See Bangladesh take on Afghanistan.

Enjoy the atmosphere, the sunshine, the lights, the crowd and the banter; all the things that make cricket culture so great.

The ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 is contested by the 10 Full Members of the International Cricket Council (ICC), together with four Associate and Affiliate Members that qualify through the ICC Cricket World Cup qualifying programme.

Check the Cricket World Cup's website for full details. Ticketing information will be released later in 2013.

name: Winning Edge Presentations Preview Day 2015
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Join them for fashions on the field with categories such as Classic Ladies Racewear.

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room for a carvery lunch or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar. Purchase a members' day ticket for $15. Table bookings $25. Local racing starts approximately 12:30pm.

name: PULSE: Reflections on the body
description:
PULSE: Reflections on the body incorporates the work of twenty five contemporary Australian artists. Today as medical science increasingly employs prosthetics, the distinctions between the natural and the fabricated body is blurring more and more.

Consisting of an exhibition, a performance program, and a series of floor-talks and public conversations, the project is curated by Mark Bayly, CMAG's Assistant Director, Exhibitions and Collections.

A vibrant place in the heart of the city, Canberra Museum and Gallery celebrates the region's social history and visual arts with dynamic exhibitions and unique programs and events.
address: Cnr London Circuit and Civic Square, Canberra City

name: ICC Cricket World Cup 2015: West Indies v Zimbabwe
description:
The ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 is coming to the nation's capital! See the West Indies take on Zimbabwe at Manuka Oval.

Enjoy the atmosphere, the sunshine, the lights, the crowd and the banter; all the things that make cricket culture so great.

The ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 is contested by the 10 Full Members of the International Cricket Council (ICC), together with four Associate and Affiliate Members that qualify through the ICC Cricket World Cup qualifying programme.

Check the Cricket World Cup's website for full details. Ticketing information will be released later in 2013.

name: ICC Cricket World Cup 2015: South Africa v Ireland
description:
The ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 is coming to the nation's capital! See South Africa take on Ireland at Manuka Oval.

Enjoy the atmosphere, the sunshine, the lights, the crowd and the banter; all the things that make cricket culture so great.

The ICC Cricket World Cup 2015 is contested by the 10 Full Members of the International Cricket Council (ICC), together with four Associate and Affiliate Members that qualify through the ICC Cricket World Cup qualifying programme.

Check the Cricket World Cup's website for full details. Ticketing information will be released later in 2013.

name: 2015 Seppelt Black Opal Stakes and ACTTAB Canberra Cup Race Day
description:
Seppelt Black Opal Stakes and ACTTAB Canberra Cup is Canberra's premiere race day. March 8 2015 is one of the more important autumn race days on the calendar, contested by top trainers both locally and interstate.

The action takes place both on and off the track at Thoroughbred Park. Enter the Myer Fashions on the Field competition for ladies, men and couples. Enjoy live entertainment with an exciting music act - to be announced soon.

Bring the family along for free amusement rides, roving entertainment, food stalls and quality thoroughbred horse racing in the nation's capital.

name: Cord Civil Marymead Charity and Trackside Students Race Day
description:
Enjoy a great afternoon of horse racing in the nation's capital on one of the best tracks in the country at Thoroughbred Park.

Free admission, snack bar, bookies and tote facilities available.

A free function for members only will be held in the Rich Reward Room. Contact Thoroughbred Park directly for membership!

Book a table in the members-only Black Opal Room or enjoy superb bar facilities in the Winning Post Bar (open to the public on non-feature race days). Purchase a members' day ticket for $15 and enjoy a carvery luncheon in the Black Opal Room. Table bookings $25.

name: Connect and Participate EXPO
description: The Connect and Participate Expo is a free event that brings together a diverse range of groups and clubs to showcase what they offer members and provide a forum for Canberrans to engage, face to face, with group leaders and members.  The expo provides opportunities for Canberrans to meet like minded people and have an opportunity to join a group. There will be a variety of stage performances from local, informal groups - from dancing, to singing, to performing arts, instrumentalists, martial arts and more. The Kingston markets food stalls and coffee shop will be open to the public.

name: Auto Italia Canberra
description:
Auto Italia is Canberra's premier annual display of Italian automotives delivering cars, motorbikes and scooters from across the nation in spectacular fashion. Not just a car display, but a cultural event as well - you can experience Italian food, music and art on the lawns of Old Parliament House.

This year's event celebrate's the 100th Anniversary of 'Maserati and will see a huge turn out from interstate travellers to display their rare and exotic cars alongside Fiats, Alfa Romeos, Ferraris, Maseratis, Ducatis and more.

Bring along the whole family for this wonderful annual event!
